headline: AmEx profits surge 13% as affluent customers splurge on luxury goods and travel
summary: American Express saw its profits grow 13% in the fourth quarter, as the credit card giant continues to benefit from its well-to-do clientele spending heavily on their cards on everything from luxury goods to restaurants to travel.  As it has been for several quarters, AmEx continues to get its cardmembers to spend heavily on their cards with perks and rewards.  The company did a refresh of the Platinum Card in September, adding benefits like a $400 annual dining credit but at the same time increasing the annual fee to $895.

The company did a refresh of the Platinum Card in September, adding benefits like a $400 annual dining credit but at the same time increasing the annual fee to $895.

headline: American Express Falls After Earnings. The Stock Is Having a Rocky Start to 2026.
summary: Shares of  American Express  dropped Friday after the credit-card giant’s quarterly earnings slightly missed analysts’ estimates and its 2026 outlook met expectations.  American Express stock fell 2.7% Friday.  President Donald Trump’s call to cap credit-card interest rates at 10% for one year hasn’t helped, though that policy may have a more muted impact on American Express’ generally high-credit clientele.

headline: American Express (NYSE:AXP) Misses Q4 CY2025 Sales Expectations
summary: Global payments company American Express (NYSE:AXP) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, but sales rose 10.6% year on year to $17.57 billion. Its GAAP profit of $3.53 per share was in line with analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: American Express Faces 10% Rate Cap Debate And Valuation Questions
summary: U.S. lawmakers have put forward a proposal to cap credit card interest rates at 10%. The plan is aimed at consumer borrowing costs and would apply across major issuers, including American Express (NYSE:AXP). Industry leaders, including JPMorgan's CEO, have publicly criticized the proposal, calling it an "economic disaster." For a company like American Express, which blends card issuing with a large payments network, a 10% cap would directly affect its lending economics. The proposal comes...

headline: Energy earnings, Fed commentary, inflation data: What to Watch
